topic.title: Uncorrectable Internal Error

body.p: An Internal Error is an error associated with a component in the system which may not be directly related to PCI Express transactions. These include parity failures in logic to RAM, double bit ECC errors, and others. An Uncorrectable Internal Error is an error that occurs on a component that results in improper operation of the component.

In Switchtec, datapath integrity is designed for the primary internal components, especially those components in the datapath, including the port and switch core. When a correctable internal error is detected, it will be corrected and not reported since it does not impact component or device operation. Instead when uncorrectable internal errors happen, Switchtec will report AER with "Uncorrectable Internal Error" and prevent the following TLPs from forwarding in the components where the errors happen. Moreover, if enabled, the switch event manager will also log the event with detailed internal error information. These kinds of errors will be more generally referred in this document as IER errors.
